item.title: Basic Python: using regular expressions

item.title: Project 1: Data Wrangling and Exploratory Analysis
item.description: tinytex::install_tinytex() library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(forcats) # data wb <- read.csv("worldbank.csv", header = TRUE) glimpse(wb) ## Observations: 11,067 ## Variables: 20 ## $ Series.Name <fct> "Population, total", "Population, total", "Population,… ## $ Series.Code <fct> SP.POP.TOTL, SP.POP.TOTL, SP.POP.TOTL, SP.POP.TOTL, SP… ## $ Country.Name <fct> "Afghanistan", "Albania", "Algeria", "American Samoa",… ## $ Country.Code <fct> AFG, ALB, DZA, ASM, AND, AGO, ATG, ARG, ARM, ABW, AUS,… ## $ X2000..YR2000. <fct> 20779953, 3089027, 31042235, 57821, 65390, 16395473, 7… ## $ X2001.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.0 ✓ purrr 0.3.3 ## ✓ tibble 2.1.3 ✓ dplyr 0.8.5 ## ✓ tidyr 1.0.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(tidyverse) library(lmtest) ## Loading required package: zoo ## ## Attaching package: 'zoo' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## as.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects using R -Data Wrangling and Exploratory Analysis: used data regarding SARS outbreak and data from World Bank; tried to find correlations between the outbreak of SARS and various factors -Modeling, Inference, Prediction: statistical modeling using Crohn disease data (chronic inflammatory disease of the intestines)
